page.title: 05The Farming Scene.
page.content: The area comprises of agricultural farmland, rough grazing, woodland and a small acreage used for horticulture. There are two large estates which are broken into smaller farms, some organised from the estate offices and some let to tenant farmers. There are several Fresian milking herds varying in size from 50-500 cows. Herds of Herefords and Charolais cattle are kept for beef. There are several large flocks of sheep, breeds include:- Blue Leicester/Swaydell cross, Suffolk and Welsh Mountain, these are kept on the higher ground. Crops grown include oats, barley, wheat, potatoes, peas, maize and grass for silage and hay. The main changes people have noticed include reduction in labour because of improved and larger machinery, removal of hedges and ditches and the increasing use of irrigation.
